summary: Precious metals kept shining, powered by concerns over the “debasement” of the U.S. dollar.  Front-month gold futures gained 1.7% to close at $4,043.40 per troy ounce, a new record. headline: Is there an AI bubble? Financial institutions sound a warning
summary: Lingering doubts about the economic promise of artificial intelligence technology are starting to get the attention of financial institutions that raised warning flags this week about an AI investment bubble.  Officials at the Bank of England on Wednesday flagged the growing risk that tech stock prices pumped up by the AI boom could burst.  “The risk of a sharp market correction has increased,” the U.K. central bank said.

headline: Nvidia–xAI boosts chip stocks, Equifax strikes back against FICO
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman outlines three of Wednesday's top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Chip stocks continue to rise on Bloomberg reports — now confirmed by Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang — that Nvidia is among the investors financing the latest funding round for Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk's artificial intelligence (AI) company, xAI (XAAI.PVT). Equifax (EFX) stock surges after the company cut its credit score data prices, striking back against FICO (FICO). AST Spacemobile (ASTS) stock skyrockets on news of the company's deal with Verizon (VZ). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Elon Musk's xAI to raise $20B, & Nvidia is investing: Bloomberg

headline: Musk's xAI Taps Nvidia and Others to Raise $20 Billion
summary: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI is raising more financing than initially planned, tapping backers including Nvidia Corp. to lift its ongoing funding round to $20 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter. Nvidia's CEO Jensen In an interview with CNBC Wednesday, Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang said when asked about Bloomberg's reporting that the only regret he has about xAI and Musk is that he "didn't give him more money." Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

raw.headline: Musk's xAI Taps Nvidia and Others to Raise $20 Billion

headline: Gold soars above $4K, Nvidia and xAI, Fed minutes: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) move higher in Wednesday's pre-market trading after all three of the major market indexes (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) closed Tuesday's session in negative territory. Meanwhile, gold (GC=F) prices soar higher after breaking above $4,000 per ounce. According to a Bloomberg News report, Nvidia (NVDA) plans to invest up to $2 billion in Elon Musk's xAI (XAAI.PVT) as the latter hopes to raise $20 billion in its latest funding round. The Federal Reserve's September FOMC meeting minutes are due out later today, after commentary from several officials highlighted caution in cutting interest rates amid the data breakout resulting from the US government shutdown. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Cisco rolls out chip designed to connect AI data centers over vast distances
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Cisco Systems launched on Wednesday a new networking chip designed to connect artificial intelligence data centers, with the cloud computing units of Microsoft and Alibaba enrolling as the chip's customers.  The P200 chip, as Cisco calls it, will compete against rival offerings from Broadcom.  It will sit at the heart of a new routing device that the company also rolled out on Wednesday and is designed to connect the sprawling data centers that are located over vast distances and which train AI systems.

raw.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Cisco Systems launched on Wednesday a new networking chip designed to connect artificial intelligence data centers, with the cloud computing units of Microsoft and Alibaba enrolling as the chip's customers.  The P200 chip, as Cisco calls it, will compete against rival offerings from Broadcom.  It will sit at the heart of a new routing device that the company also rolled out on Wednesday and is designed to connect the sprawling data centers that are located over vast distances and which train AI systems.

headline: Bank of England warns of AI valuations as Oracle looks to rebound
summary: Concerns are rising about the AI trade on Wall Street, and now the Bank of England is weighing in. The central bank warning in a new report that valuations are "stretched." And it comes after a report from The Information raised worries about Oracle's (ORCL) profit margins from Nvidia (NVDA) chips. But Softbank (SFTBY) is doubling down, as it announced an acquisition of ABB's (ABBN.SW) robotics unit for $5.4 billion. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Crypto race to tokenize stocks raises investor protection flags
summary: NEW YORK/PARIS (Reuters) -A race by crypto companies to sell tokens pegged to stocks is raising alarm bells among traditional financial firms and regulatory experts who warn that the fast-growing novel products pose risks to investors and market stability.  Buoyed by President Donald Trump's pro-crypto stance and his administration's push for friendly regulations, the crypto industry is rushing to capitalize on a global surge in enthusiasm for the sector.  Robinhood, Gemini and Kraken among others have launched tokenized stocks in Europe, while Coinbase, Robinhood and startup Dinari are seeking approval to launch similar products in the United States.

raw.headline: Crypto race to tokenize stocks raises investor protection flags

Buoyed by President Donald Trump's pro-crypto stance and his administration's push for friendly regulations, the crypto industry is rushing to capitalize on a global surge in enthusiasm for the sector.  Robinhood, Gemini and Kraken among others have launched tokenized stocks in Europe, while Coinbase, Robinhood and startup Dinari are seeking approval to launch similar products in the United States.

headline: Nvidia to Finance Musk’s xAI Chips as Part of $20 Billion Deal
summary: The financing includes equity and debt in a special purpose vehicle that will buy Nvidia processors and rent them to xAI for use in its Colossus 2 project, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the information is private.  Nvidia is investing as much as $2 billion in the equity portion of the transaction, the people said, a strategy by the chipmaker that helps accelerate its customers’ AI investments.
